reviews.review_msg: Good prof Very demanding course Tests are tough but pretty fair Don't miss lectures

avoid bisc303, it is the most work required for a class i have ever experienced. her exams were very difficult, the final had two essays and was out of 130, all long and short answer. it took me the full 3 hours to wrtie it with not time to double check. lectures are boring and you must study the textbook to know the details she wants

Her lectures may be boring but they are easy to follow. A lot of in-class written notes though. Midterm was hard and tricky but the final was much more fair. Lab assignments takes a BIG chunk out of your week so keep that in mind. If you're good at memorizing small details you'll do fine.
Dr. Moore is awesome and helpful.  Not only guides her students throughout the course but very helpful and put extra time to help you.  She is a very sweet person!
Pretty good prof..clear notes (specfic and concise) and understandable..good at explaining things..exams are fair..

Dr. Moore taught half of the course. I love the fact that she used a tablet to write notes on her slideshow. Lectures were of a slower pace since you had to "copy" your notes as they weren't posted but also good since it limits the amount of material covered. Great prof. Lectures were clear and no surprises on any of the exams.

Think about learning bits and pieces of random things about bacteria/fungi/viruses and then having to regurgitate them for your exam.  This course tries to cover way too much about so many broad topics.  Thumbs down.  Budget your time for the MT.  And bring an alarm clock because Margo puts you to sleeeeeep.
Best prof I've had at SFU so far.  Hard marker... make sure you pay attention to samll details.

Amazing prof, very helpful and approachable.  No assignments due, just midterms/final.  Include adequate detail in your answers and seek extra help if you need it and you will do well.  Overall a very interesting class and relevant to future kin classes (kin 205, 305, 306) if you're a kin major.

Dr.Moore~ One of the best profs ever! She's well-organised, warm, and professional. Read the text, go to the classes, never miss the tutorials, seek for extra help, then you will ace what u want. This prof- made me want to major in MBB.

Work hard in this class and seek extra help when you don't understand something and you will succeed.  She is very approachable and friendly and willing to help.  Exams are fair but make sure you include lots of detail in your answers.  Study the notes and you're fine.

Study her notes very well and u'll do fine...consult the textbook if you encounter any problems along the way.Pleasant teacher to have. Lectures may kind of be boring, but it is more enjoyable than just seating there and listening to prof. talk.

lots of memorizing !!!!!
 
 Exams are tough .....and your answers should have exact words as in her notes. Her notes are good. But you really have to work very hard...from the first lecture to get marks on her midterms.

Well her notes are pretty good. I never had to open the textbook becuz it was all in her notes. The midterms and final was fair. Just a lot of memorizing and spitting it out exactly the way she wanted it.
Very good prof, she had the best lecture notes in my university career so far. Also very approachable and friendly.
Awesome prof.  Very clear and enthusiastic.  Only problem was that the exams were too long for the time allotted.  Avoid this class if you can't write FAST.
No Comments

On the whole I am not a fan of her. She rambles on and on, non stop during her lectures, giving out 'half-notes' that you spend so much time copying that you don't have time to listen to her. Sounds like a nagging mother and didn't scale our class' marks.
she's very helpful.ll do well if u memorize her notes only.
She is a really good prof..wheah...
